concept.title: Verify the Referrer with the Adobe Debugger
concept.shortdesc: Run a test to verify that the referrer, originating URL (s_server) and campaign variables are being captured.

conbody.p: These variables will be represented as the following parameters in the Adobe Debugger.

entry.b: Value as Shown in the DigitalPulse Debugger

entry.p: This value will appear in the DigitalPulse Debugger if the pageURL variable is used.

This value will NOT appear in the DigitalPulse Debugger if the
pageURL variable is used.

conbody.p: The text that the debugger displays should correspond to the following example:
conbody.codeblock:
Image
http://flywithuscom.112.2o7.net/b/ss/flywithuscom/1/JS-1.4/s61944015791667?[AQB] ndh=1 t=4/8/2014 13:34:28 4 360 pageName=Welcome to FlyWithUs.com r=http://ref=www.google.com/search?hl=en&ie=UTF-8&q=discount+airline+tickets cc=USD g=http://www.flytohawaiiforfree.com s=1280x1024 c=32 j=1.3 v=Y k=Y bw=1029 bh=716 ct=lan hp=N [AQE]
conbody.p: After verifying that the Adobe Debugger displays these variables, it is always helpful to confirm that the search terms and the original referring domain (prior to the redirect) are registering traffic in reports.
